column4: could someone help me to use dmesg, to troubleshoot a usb drive (mp3) ?
yeah nopaste the dmesg output
thanks!
dmesg http://www.nopaste.com/p/acEJa9OHT
I have a lot of these error -71 I think that is the device
maybe its a problem with the usb controler or its driver(s), do other thumbdrives work?
or external usb disks or something
yes a usb drive works,
the only driver for windows is unsigned
i had a similar problem on one my laptops and solved it by removing the usb 2.0 driver using modprobe -r ehci_hcd, when it pluged it back in it worked
what do you mean by plugged in back in? physically or did you reboot?
i just pluged the thumbdrive back in after running that command
oh got ya, is ehci_hcd specific for your needs or should I run that command as well ?
its the usb 2.0 driver module
thanks I'm still a newbie to linux
thank you so much!!
does that work?
yeah, it poped up immedatly I minimized it trying to see if it worked or not took me a few seconds to realise
did it load that module again? if not it will be running usb 1.1 now but still that would be better than not working at all
does lsmod|grep ehci_hcd gives anything back?
no nothing is returned,, which means it's a usb 1.1 .. right?
yeah
thanks a lot!
